entries.title: AI changelog web app completed
entries.whats_new: The web application for automatically summarizing GitHub changes has been finished, with API deployed on Railway and front-end on Vercel.
entries.breaking_change: The app now automatically summarizes changes based on commit history, changing how users receive changelog updates.
entries.impact: Users will now get automatic, summarized changelog updates without manual entry, simplifying updates.

entries.title: Open API configuration options added
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repository, OpenAI LLM, and API keys for personalized changelog generation.
entries.breaking_change: The system now supports user-specific configurations for repositories and AI models, offering more customization.
entries.impact: Users can tailor the changelog generation to their own repositories and AI preferences, increasing flexibility.

entries.title: Bug fixes on saving to Git and LLM enhancements
entries.whats_new: Fixed issues related to saving data to Git and improved the LLM to better detect breaking changes automatically.
entries.impact: The system is more reliable in saving changelog data and better detects important changes, improving user experience.

entries.title: Cache and entries management improvements
entries.whats_new: Implemented strategies to cache changelog data locally and on GitHub, with limits on the number of entries stored.
entries.impact: Performance and reliability are improved by caching; users experience faster load times and improved data management.

entries.title: Frontend interface enhancements and detail page
entries.whats_new: Enhanced the user interface, including a detailed changelog page where clicking an entry navigates to detailed information.
entries.impact: Navigation and readability of changelogs are improved, making it easier for users to find detailed change logs.

entries.title: Interface management and UI polishing
entries.whats_new: Merged interfaces into a single file for easier management, decorated pages, added loading effects, and cleaned up code.
entries.impact: Development and maintenance are streamlined, resulting in a smoother user experience.

entries.title: Connection of frontend and backend via JSON cache
entries.whats_new: Implemented a strategy where the backend generates a JSON cache file that the front-end loads to display changelogs.
entries.breaking_change: The backend now generates a JSON cache before serving changelog data, altering how data retrieval works.
entries.impact: Speeds up loading times and improves user experience by serving static cached data instead of real-time computation.

entries.title: Basic backend API and LLM update
entries.whats_new: Implemented initial backend API and updated the LLM to support detection of auto-find breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: The system now supports automatic detection of breaking changes within commits, changing how changelogs are generated.
entries.impact: Enhanced detection of significant changes allows for more accurate and informative changelog summaries.

entries.title: Support for detailed commit info with new LLM
entries.whats_new: Released a second version of the LLM that now includes additional details like date, impact, title, and notes for each commit.
entries.impact: More comprehensive commit summaries improve the clarity and usefulness of changelog entries.
